channel.title: Moparscape on VPS
channel.description:
i got a question about a VPS. i know Moparscape doesn't require so much, but i wanna see what you guys have to say, if it can runs on this VPS
[b]SPECS:[/b] [b]RAM: 512 MB [b]Remote Desktop Connection[/b] : 1 [b]Disk Space[/b]: 6 GB [b]Bandwidth/mo[/b]: 200 GB [b]Dedicated IP Address[/b]: 1 DNS Hosting: YES [b]Firewall/Intrusion Protection[/b]: YES [b]Plesk 9.0[/b]: YES
NOTE: it was the cheapest they had :P

item.title: Moparscape on VPS
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:12, topic:331392”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=427771.msg3141582#msg3141582 date=1267588863]
That vps is shit.

My mom just bought be a computer from a closing satilite dish company and it has 480mb ram and like a 80gb hard drive, and she payed 70 bucks

it also included win xp pro disk with code, monitor, mouse, keyboard. I think I got off better then your vps
[/quote]

Might want to put more ram in it. .5Gb of ram is not that great.[/quote]

Its more of a backup computer now, also it came with the win xp pro disk.
Now my main computer has win xp pro and not home.

Also you should upgrade your vps, if I could pay 70 bucks for something better then thats just sad. :s

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape on VPS
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Why bother including RAM if you don’t include the processor?

If you’re wanting to run a wL server, chances are you’re not going to make it far with those specs. Horrible hard drive too. 6GB???

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape on VPS
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Moufazin:

how many people do you think can be online at the same time, if i use my Windows VPS ?

Depends on how stable and efficient your server is.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape on VPS
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“Moufazin, post:5, topic:331392”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=427771.msg3141198#msg3141198 date=1267546069]

Ram is very bad.

Ignore this person.

Seems like a decent package, just run a decent server(no 1mb client classes) and it will be perfect for your needs.
Looking at “Remote desktop connections” this looks like a windows vps, correct me if i’m wrong. If it is running windows I would recommend a linux based OS and run your server from command line so you can preserve as much ram as possible.
[/quote]

Yes, i got windows.
and thank you. but can’t you run a command line with windows? if that aint possible, im thinkin changing to linux then.[/quote]

It’s just that Windows uses more memory than Linux (just think, it has to render the UI and do loads of other stuff in the background). With more memory free your server will be faster.

Read full topic

Yes, i got windows.
and thank you. but can’t you run a command line with windows? if that aint possible, im thinkin changing to linux then.

Read full topic
